org.webchecker.forms

Class Forms

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.webchecker.forms.Forms

  • public final class Forms
extends java.lang.Object
    Module for manipulating HTML forms from Web Checker library. It is designed as singleton, which can only have open one HTML page at time, but it returns instances of Forms and you can change pages at your wish. So in the end, you can have prepared any number of Forms you like, even from different web pages, and manipulate them as you please.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ondřej Štorc <o.storc@outlook.com>, Filip Sohajek <filip.sohajek@gmail.com>, Jindřich Máca (Tuník)

      • openDocument

        public void openDocument(org.jsoup.nodes.Document document)

        Parameters:

      • selectForm

        public Form selectForm(java.lang.String identifier)
                throws java.net.MalformedURLException
        Should select form element by identifier from currently opened page/document and return it. When application doesn't found any element, application will return null. When found element is not form, application will try found another matching element, but if at page isn't any matching element application return null. When on the page is more then one elements with same identifier, application will select first matching form element.
        Parameters:
        identifier - is CSS selector String. For more information's about CSS selectors visit this page
        Returns:
        new instance of Form, which contains elements of found form and url page of Document
        Throws:
        java.net.MalformedURLException - if document has wrong url identifier
